DOC.brief_summary: The pronounced effect of goiter on the esophagus needs further exploration, as the mechanisms by which goiter leads to swallowing difficulties are unknown. By investigating esophageal motility using high resolution esophageal manometry before and after thyroidectomy we seek to examine the impact of the goiter mass on the esophagus and swallowing with six months follow-up.
DOC.brief_title: Changes in Esophageal Motility and Swallowing Symptoms After Thyroid Surgery
DOC.criteria: Patients with symptomatic benign nodular goiter referred for thyroidectomy Previous surgery to the neck; Suspicion of thyroid cancer Age below 20 years or above 80 years Neuromuscular disease.
